sentences.english: Is similar to the overwhelming majority thunderbolt, the network becomes the first disseminator .
sentences.chinese: 如同绝大多数突发事件，网络成为最先传播者。

sentences.english: C. I'm usually the first person to strike up a conversation with strangers.
sentences.chinese: 我通常是最先与陌生人攀谈的人。

sentences.english: I was only 3 and itis the my second youngest memory.
sentences.chinese: 我当时才3岁，是我最先有记忆的两件事情之一。

sentences.english: They first came to Atlantic Canada to fish and trade with Aboriginal peoples.
sentences.chinese: 他们最先来到“大西洋加拿大“捕鱼及与土箸通商。

sentences.english: When the age of Ugly philosophy approaches, the breakthrough first happens in literature.
sentences.chinese: 丑学时代来临时，最先在文艺领域找到了突破口。

sentences.english: Amylaceous most first by which is peptic digested?
sentences.chinese: 淀粉最先由哪个消化器官消化？

sentences.english: One of the first humor rooms was established at St. Joseph's Hospital in Houston.
sentences.chinese: 休斯敦圣约瑟夫医院是最先建立幽默小屋的医院之一。

sentences.english: Singles Day was first celebrated at  various universities in Nanjing, capital city of Jiangsu Province during the 1990s.
sentences.chinese: 光棍节最先在90年代的江苏南京各大高校兴起。

sentences.english: In the college, the professor he met first was an advocate of truth.
sentences.chinese: 在学院里，他最先遇到的教授是一个真理的提倡者。

sentences.english: He was the first to spy the horseman in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 他最先看到出现在远处的骑者。

sentences.english: Xiaolongbao will the first dim sum to be included on the list.
sentences.chinese: 小笼包会是最先被列入名单的点心。

sentences.english: Who is Actually the First Person Using the Word "Kexue" in China?
sentences.chinese: 究竟谁在中国最先使用了“科学”一词？

sentences.english: Finishing a goal is only the first part of the goal-setting process.
sentences.chinese: 完成一个目标仅仅是设定目标过程的最先步骤。

sentences.english: In Hong Kong, PolyU is the forerunner and sole provider of design education at tertiary level.
sentences.chinese: 理大是本港最先及唯一一所开办设计教育的高等院校。

sentences.english: Stromatolites were the first to exhale oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 叠层石是最先释放氧气的。

sentences.english: A version of this article originally appeared in The McKinsey Quarterly.
sentences.chinese: 本篇文章的另一个版本最先出现在《麦肯锡季刊》上。

definition: to be just about to/to have just started to
to take the lead/to show initiative
as it turns out/by lucky coincidence/(of number, time, size etc) just right
to rush (to do sth urgent)/to try to be the first/to forestall
to agree by chance (idiom); taking the same action without prior consultation
